column4: Salesforce shares spike on report of Microsoft evaluating bid
column5: Shares of Salesforce.com Inc  jumped as much as 6.4 percent on Tuesday after a Bloomberg report that Microsoft Corp  was evaluating a bid for the cloud software provider.

column4: UPDATE 1-Salesforce shares spike on report of Microsoft evaluating bid
column5: May 5 Shares of Salesforce.com Inc  jumped as much as 6.4 percent on Tuesday after a Bloomberg report that Microsoft Corp was evaluating a bid for the cloud software provider.

column4: Sky? Skype? EU court backs Murdoch over Microsoft in name battle
column5: LUXEMBOURG In a clash of corporate titans over naming rights in a fast-changing industry  Microsoft and its Skype phone service came out on the losing side of an EU court battle on Tuesday with Rupert Murdoch's television business Sky.

column4: Sky? Skype? EU court backs Murdoch over Microsoft in name battle
column5: LUXEMBOURG  May 5 In a clash of corporate titans over naming rights in a fast-changing industry  Microsoft  and its Skype phone service came out on the losing side of an EU court battle on Tuesday with Rupert Murdoch's television business Sky.

column4: Salesforce shares spike on report of Microsoft evaluating bid
column5: May 5 Shares of Salesforce.com Inc  jumped 6.2 percent in late afternoon trading on Tuesday  after Bloomberg reported that Microsoft Corp is evaluating a bid for the cloud software provider.

column4: Cisco looks to salesman Robbins for tech leadership
column5: SEATTLE Chuck Robbins  the veteran salesman chosen by Cisco Systems Inc to succeed legendary CEO John Chambers  must prove he has the technical knowledge to chart a new course and lead the network equipment maker into the new world of cloud-based computing.

column4: Nvidia to wind down Icera modem operations
column5: Nvidia Corp  said it would wind down its Icera modem operations  and was open to a sale of the technology or operations.

column4: Nvidia to wind down Icera modem operations
column5: May 5 Nvidia Corp said it would wind down its Icera modem operations  and was open to a sale of the technology or operations.

column4: Cisco looks to salesman Robbins for tech leadership
column5: SEATTLE Chuck Robbins  the veteran salesman chosen by Cisco Systems Inc to succeed legendary CEO John Chambers  must prove he has the technical knowledge to chart a new course and lead the network equipment maker into the new world of cloud-based computing.

column4: Cisco set to boost Internet speed for cable companies
column5: Network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc is set to launch a converged cable access platform  enabling cable operators offer download speeds of one gigabit a second or more.

column4: Cisco veteran Robbins to take over as CEO from Chambers
column5: Cisco Systems Inc Chief Executive John Chambers will step down in July after 20 years at the helm of the network equipment maker  a symbol of the dot.com stock boom 15 years ago now struggling to boost its bottom line in the era of cloud computing.

column4: Cisco looks to salesman Robbins for tech leadership
column5: SEATTLE  May 4 Chuck Robbins  the veteran salesman chosen by Cisco Systems Inc to succeed legendary CEO John Chambers  must prove he has the technical knowledge to chart a new course and lead the network equipment maker into the new world of cloud-based computing.
